intro: Ladanella segetum, commonly known as the field ladanella, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in open fields and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a mild aromatic scent, which is common in members of its family. Ladanella segetum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
